reviews.sentence: Very good fitness room. We stayed here for one night. Easy check in nice staff members comfortable Hilton beds quiet evening. Typically Hampton Inns have a very small fitness facility. this one was very well equipped two new Precor elliptical sand two treadmills plus weights etc. and well ventilated. Breakfast was fine standard choices. The only gripe would be that the cost was a bit steep 142 with tax.
good location to mall. as all hotels needs better pillows. Was disappointed by luke warm milk on breakfast buffet. location. Comfortable bed king of Prussia mall cold milk on breakfast buffet.

Inexpensive and Decent Qualithy. Happy with my stay. Staff friendly and rooms were clean and comfortable. Would definitely stay here again. Get there early for breakfast as arrangement with food makes it difficult with larger crowds to get to things.

GREAT HOTEL GREAT EXPERIENCE GREAT ROOM. We stopped here for 2 nights as part of our road trip down the east coast The location is ideal for the king of prussia mall and many restaurants on the main roadThe hotel is clean and friendly the rooms are of a good size and found the beds comfortable The housekeeping did a good job every day In the lobby they have 24hr coffee which is handy and the breakfast is of standard hotel fare although they did keep the breakfast area very clean and tidyThe wifi was a good connection but unles you are a hilton honors member i believe you can only have 2 devices connected so it might be worth joining beforehand if this is going to cause any issues All in all a positive experience from start to finish.
Unpleasant surprise on bed s. Good classic Hampton reliably clean with good breakfast. Paid for a King bed and got one double to small and too cramped.

Good Experience. I have stayed at this property multiple times always during a very busy weekend. The hotel staff is consistently friendly and helpful the rooms are always clean the beds are comfortable and they manage to keep the lobby neat and clean with a full house. I recommend this property close to everything. next to the King of Prussia Mall.

Meh Hotel in Suburban Area of Phily. The location worked for me but it was a rather run down hotel. The chair in my room was completely broken which is a sign that things are not well maintained. King of Prussia mall is nearby which is a plus. Overall a meh experience. The weekend I stayed the price was jacked up because it was the weekend of the Pope visit. Would not likely stay there again.

Meh Hotel in Suburban Area of Phily. The location worked for me but it was a rather run down hotel. The chair in my room was completely broken which is a sign that things are not well maintained. King of Prussia mall is nearby which is a plus. Overall a meh experience. The weekend I stayed the price was jacked up because it was the weekend of the Pope visit. Would not likely stay there again.

Showing its age and not quite to Hampton Inn standards. This was an average to disappointing stay at at Hampton Inn. I am HiltonHonors member so I generally prefer to stay at these locations but this hotel was below my expectations. The building is old and while the reception and breakfast area have been remodeled to the Hampton standards the rest of the hotel does not seem to have completely transformed. For example they changed the door numbering so there are new signs for the door numbers on the walls next to the rooms. But the numbers used to be on the doors and you can see that they used to be there. The glue from the numbers is still showing. Plus the walls showed many signs of not being repainted. The mattresses and frames were shaky and noisy. I had a hard time adjusting the heat and making sure it was going on and off to keep the room at the right temperature. In the end took patience. And I bundled in the covers very cold night. Breakfast was as my son said sad. Standard food but not with any energy or care. Staff was nice and I have no complaints about service. Just would not choose to stay there again.

Fantastic. I was really suprised and impressed that everything was the best I can imagine. Service Quality of the facility Food Amenities. Even used the Fitness Center and it was great. I was sad I could not find such a great hotel later in my trip. The beds were also the best I have ever slept on in a hotel. On check in there was a slight problem with a group of high school athletes the supervisor was amazing at resolving things and I felt well taken care of.

Somewhat disappointing for a Hampton Inn. Hampton Inns are our preferred hotel so we stayed at the Hampton Inn during our stop in King of Prussia. We found it to be disappointing compared to the many Hamptons that we have stayed in. However in our opinion even a disappointing Hampton Inn is better than many brands in it is price range. Our room was satisfactory in all respects but three. It looked out on the Pennsylvania Turnpike as do all rear facing rooms and the road noise was noticeable the tissue dispenser in the bathroom had only a couple of tissues and there was no backup box and the pillows were awful. There was no distinct business center. Instead there was a kiosk with a single PC and a printer off to the side in the lobby. This was inadequate in our opinion. The breakfast was fine as is customary in Hamptons but the breakfast seating area was really insufficient. The reception staff was pleasant and helpful. I am not inclined to rate this hotel as poor overall but it was disappointing.

Nice Stay. Great staff. Very friendly and helpful. Some of the rooms are a little old but very clean. Some of the outlets in the room did not work and the Wifi would not connect. However it was an overall good stay. I will be back.

This hotel is OK in a pinch but look elsewhere. Stayed at this hotel one night before meeting. The hotel is easily accessible off West Dekalb Pike near the King of Prussia mall. Walked in the lobby and it was crowded since it was the weekend of the DNC. The temperature was a bit uncomfortable too as it was warm and the crowd did not help. The staff for checking in was friendly and helpful but that is about all I can say was above average. I got a room on the 6th floor and in taking the elevators I learned quick that they were hot and slow. The room itself was fine. You can see that they are a bit worn out around the edges and the toilet was in rough shape but nothing that makes it unlivable. However the room was very warm do you see a theme here for the entire hotel as the temp was 74 degrees when we walked in. The setting was on 68 so it shows how poor the A C is. I turned it down to 65 and by time I got back from dinner and an errand it was only 72The bed was comfortable and large and the pillows were adequate. When I woke up the temp was only at 68 so it is safe to say the AC is just awful. I went down to breakfast and was wholly disappointed. The food they had was just plain bad. They had some sort of omletes that were clearly microwaved and then some sort of crepe type thing that was disgusting. Obviously it is hard to mess up bagels etc. so they should just save their money and keep those things stocked. Overall I would suggest looking elsewhere first. Location near many restaurants and mall. Close to highways. Numerous restaurants a ton of shopping. TemperatureAlso breakfast.

Not bad. It was not a bad stay the hotel was just dated. the breakfast was not as good as at other Hampton Inns I have stayed. They did not have quite the amount of food selections as other Hampton Inn hotels.

Poor service and cleanliness Unfriendly and impolite staff. The cleaning lady did not say hi or bye. The receptionist on Sunday had a poor attitude. We were very disappointed about the stay and will not come back to this hotel location.

Average Hampton Inn. A little dated but they seem to be under construction. Tried to get ice from 2 ice machines and got nothing. Also AC did not seem to be working but too late in the night and not bad enough to complain.

Never using bokingcom or staying in Hampton Inn again. I booked a room with a King size bed online the bed in our room was a Full size. we are both over 6 ft tall and was very unhappy with this. When I asked about the mistake I was told bokingcom just shows you available rooms and NOT accurately. Of course they had no other rooms available for us to move to. The receptionist said sorry as if she had said it a million times already and expected a complaint. did not seem like she cared one bit and hung up the phone. The shower head was broken and had a folded up brochure holding it in place which did not work very well. The room smelled like old man Cologne. I am glad I brought my air freshener. I will never go back to Hampton Inn and I will never use bokingcom again. The only reason they are not getting a 0 rating from me is because it is in a good location.

Terrible Construction and Housekeeping Security. Normally love Hampton Inns because they are reasonably priced and clean. Not the case here. This location is under mass construction and resembles a combat zone more than a hotel under remodel. It was very dirty and loud. I realize these things are necessary but I would not expect to pay full price. I came back one afternoon to find my door unlocked and the security bar open so that the room was open to anyone that wanted in. While I am sure this was accidentally done by housekeeping there was no effort to apologize or to make things right by hotel management. In my opinion this was a major miss by their management staff. While I was lucky something was not missing from the room this could have been bad.

Horrible experience never go to this hotel. The water was off The first day at this hotel. They told me that the water will be back on around 8 PM and at 10 PM when I left for my birthday the water was not still on. Then when I came back at 1 am the water was freezing cold. Until 8 am was when I could finally take a shower. I could not even wash up or wash my face the first night. Worst hotel experience in my entire life.

Average Hotel. I recently stayed here while on business and while my experience was not bad it was not great. I chose a room on the side facing the turnpike and that was a big mistake. The hotel was much closer than I thought so the room was pretty noisy all night. The only window in the room was stuck in the corner and had a motorized shade but I never found the switch to make it work so the room was pretty light all night as well. The hotel is under renovation which did not cause much of a problem for my stay so hopefully there will be improvements that will make this a better place to stay.

Room is standard and clean. Bathroom good size soft towels. Older building and elevators are a little sketchy. When closing they beep twice and after that they will shut no matter what is in between the doors. Tried to hold open for coming guest and had to pull my hand out from being squished between closing doors. No exaggeration.

Disappointing. This was our second stay at this Hampton Inn and I was very disappointed. Upon check in around 7PM we were directed to a room that had not yet been serviced by housekeeping and were given another room. The following evening after being out since 8AM we returned about 9PM to find that our room was again not cleaned by housekeeping. The manager on duty went up and cleaned our room himself and the other staff provided a complimentary bag of snacks and drinks for the inconvenience. A staff member took my name and was going to leave a note for the manager. At checkout I was not asked how my stay was and I have yet to hear from the manager about our experience with this stay. As our son is a college freshman in the area we were planning to stay here each time we visited him several times a year however we will not be staying at this location again. I have cancelled our reservation for parents weekend and made a reservation at another area hotel with similar amenities.
Payment confusion. There was an issue with my payment and now I ’m being charged twice for my room. I ’m seriously angry and disappointed with Expedia for this issue.

Disappointing. The room was not clean enough for sleeping. I barely slept. I will never stay in a hotel with an upholstered headboard. The bedding was not laundered well enough. The breakfast had no fresh fruit or tasty proteins as most hotels have. And no laundry or pool or exercise room or spa Not a single amenity. I have never had a bad Hampton Inn experience before so I did not check it well enough before booking. Never again.
Disappointing. Close to the highway out. Location is not great unles you are visiting the mall nextdor. Dining options are thin the usual suspects anyone for the mall Fodcourt.

This hotel should close now in order to begin the renovations. We stayed from Friday August 17 to Sunday August 19Checked into Room 404 which Housekeeping had been to and found mucho hair in the bathroom sink. The friendly clerk switched us to 702. Room had been cleaned half hazardly. In the morning I asked the front desk clerk to send someone to repair the curtain chain because it did not work so there was no natural light. No one came to repair this. Housekeeping skipped us altogether. This hotel is scheduled for renovations in November 2018. In the meantime it is dicrepit. Management seems to have abandoned this property.
Not bad good location. Several room problems. tub leaked light over bathroom mirror out. construction on first floor.

Not the best location in KOP. The location access is hard to get to. The property had seen better days very run down look in hallways and elevator. Rooms have a bad odor housekeeping is minimal and misses things. Breakfast is meh. Night staff is unhelpful and acts like you are interrupting their nap.
Very Good. Staff was very friendly breakfast was very nice. Small window in our room and the blind was broken. So it was kinda dark in our room.

Dumpster hotel. I ’ve spoken to management sent 3 emails. This place is a dump. First room dirty barking dog down the hall thermostat broken second room at check in smelled like mold. Third room was dirty hair in the shower which stayed their during my entire visit. Has anyone else noticed that the wood look tile by the elevator and in the rooms once had white grout. It ’s now black. I have pictures. Anyone ever take notice to the crap remodel job that was down doors do n’t slide on the bathroom shower hardware was never cleaned holes in the tile miss cut marble backsplash that you can see the dirt back there. Check out the rust on the lamp fixtures in the room look at the bed bottom it needs paint. The elevator has how many different color light bulbs. The wood trim looks like it was installed by gradeschol kids. Checkout the black spray painted 2x4 sink vanity in the public restroom across from the front desk. Do you need more. I can see it the customers can. Why ca n’t anyone else that works for this place see the issues. I was with a business group my one co worker had flies in her room.
